answers.a: E999 is quillaia extract, a saponin-rich soapbark extract used as a foaming/emulsifying agent in foods and drinks. Any “Kindle error” reference to E999 is unrelated to this food additive.

answers.q: what is quillaia extract in root beer
answers.a: In root beer, quillaia extract is a natural foaming agent that creates and stabilizes the creamy head and can help disperse flavor oils.

answers.q: what is quillaia extract made from
answers.a: It’s made from the inner bark and small branches of the soapbark tree (Quillaja saponaria), rich in saponins along with tannins and other polyphenols.

answers.q: why is quillaia extract in root beer
answers.a: It’s added to provide foam and improve emulsification, helping keep flavor oils evenly dispersed.

answers.q: an e-code from category e990 – e999 would be reported in which of the following circumstances?
answers.a: When a product contains one of these ‘miscellaneous’ additives and must list it on the ingredient label; for example, E999 appears on permitted soft drinks or desserts where it’s used as a foaming/humectant agent.
